content.value: Cloud and sensitive data - What to consider

More and more companies have started to use Cloud to store their data. This is a considerable advantage for many companies, but it also means that they have to choose and decide between many storage solutions. Different companies are in need of different solutions depending on what kind of data they will be storing.

The discussion surrounding how sensitive data should be handled is ongoing, and regulatory frameworks from suppliers and governments, such as GDPR, play a huge part in it. For companies, it is crucial to make sure that the information that is stored in the Cloud is secure and available at all times. How and where you store the data can affect this quite a bit, so it is important that you are aware of what the different solutions for your company are available. To get you started, this article will bring up some pros and cons of different cloud storage solutions.

Frameworks regarding how cloud suppliers should handle data is a constant ongoing discussion. New decisions are made regularly, which makes it difficult to stay updated. One of the larger discussions regards the Cloud act and the EU:s GDPR. The Cloud act is an American law that was passed in 2018 that is supposed to make it easier for the US government to request data from American companies, no matter where in the world the data is stored. The law helps to make the transfer of data easier for the government by working around the MLAT agreement which previously existed. The law also implies that countries outside of the US get the opportunity to request data from American companies.

The EU:s version of this is GDPR. GDPR plays a major role in this since GDPR drastically limits the transfer of data that is physically stored within EU:s borders. GDPR demands that an international agreement is in place in order to transfer data in the way that the Cloud act aspires to. Such an agreement does not exist at the present time, which means that, currently, GDPR and the Cloud act are not entirely in sync regarding the transfer of data.

This situation between the EU and the US is an indicator that the question of how data should be handled in the Cloud, and what rules and laws are in place in different countries, is something to consider carefully when selecting a cloud supplier.

When it comes to datamanagement, Swedish Cloud suppliers have a clear advantage to the international "cloudgiants". The advantage is that Swedish suppliers do not have to deal with the Cloud act because they are protected by the Swedish constitution. If your company stores a lot of sensitive data, this could play a big part in your selection of cloud supplier. It should be noted though that the Swedish suppliers cannot match the larger international supplier when it comes to size and the amount of services offered, which also is an important factor to consider when choosing a Cloud supplier.

Another aspect to consider is a so called "multi-cloud" storaging solution. As the name implies, this is means that you store your data using more than one Cloud supplier. One reason for this could be that different suppliers specialize i different areas of data, which fits certain companies better. However, one question that arises with the "multi-cloud" solution is the security aspect of it. When the data is stored at different places it can be harder to keep track of it as well as what frameworks need to considered.
What to consider as a customer
Something that quickly becomes apparent is that the solution which will fit your company

's needs best will depend on many various factors. In other words, no one solution will fit every one. We believe that the best thing to do, as a customer, is to be aware and updated on where your data is stored and what kind of access you have to it. To analyze and discuss what solution is best for your company's specific needs can save both time and money. At Altostruct, we have a great deal of experience of working with Cloud, therefore, we are highly invested in these kinds of issues, since they affect us on a daily basis. We are determined to offer our clients solutions that are specifically adjusted to their needs and wishes.
